clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacological Postconditioning During the Aortic Valvular Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacological Postconditioning During the Aortic Valvular Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Primary objective: To evaluate the efficacy of the cyclosporin A administration to induce a cardioprotection during the valvular surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: The peak of the cardiac troponin I blood level measured during the first 72 hours of surgery follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under curve of the cardiac troponin I release, BNP, length of mechanical ventilation, length of stay in ICU, SAPS, necessity of a catecholaminergic support to assure hemodynamic stability, SAE

arm_group.description: a single bolus of 2.5 mg/kg, administered before aortic cross-declamping
No cyclosporine A is administered before aortic cross-declamping

intervention.description: a single bolus of 2.5 mg/kg, administered before aortic cross-declamping
No cyclosporine A is administered before aortic cross-declamping.
